main event: A fast-moving, bright white object was observed in the Pacific Ocean, moving in a southerly direction before fading into the horizon.
interesting points: The object was first seen taking evening stars, and it moved rapidly across the sky.
The object reached a maximum altitude of 80 degrees to the south, leaving a trail.
The object faded 64 miles above the horizon, and was determined to likely be a satellite.
Multiple observers on a ship, including the Officer of the Deck, Junior Officer of the Deck, Executive Officer, and Quartermaster of the Watch, witnessed the object.
The weather conditions were clear and bright, with a full moon 12 degrees above the horizon.
witnesses: Officer of the Deck, Junior Officer of the Deck, Executive Officer, Quartermaster of the Watch
